definitions.definition: The soul of a person or other creature. What moves through experience into self-definition as souls purpose.
A supernatural being, often but not exclusively without physical form; ghost, fairy, angel.
definitions.example: A wandering spirit haunts the island.
School spirit is at an all-time high.

definitions.definition: The manner or style of something.
definitions.example: In the spirit of forgiveness, we didn't press charges.

definitions.definition: (usually in the plural) A volatile liquid, such as alcohol. The plural form spirits is a generic term for distilled alcoholic beverages.
One who is vivacious or lively; one who evinces great activity or peculiar characteristics of mind or temper.
definitions.example: a ruling spirit; a schismatic spirit

definitions.definition: Temper or disposition of mind; mental condition or disposition; intellectual or moral state; often in the plural.
definitions.example: to be cheerful, or in good spirits; to be down-hearted, or in bad spirits

definitions.definition: Air set in motion by breathing; breath; hence, sometimes, life itself.
A rough breathing; an aspirate, such as the letter h; also, a mark denoting aspiration.
Intent; real meaning; opposed to the letter, or formal statement.
definitions.example: the spirit of an enterprise, or of a document

definitions.definition: Any of the four substances: sulphur, sal ammoniac, quicksilver, and arsenic (or, according to some, orpiment).
To carry off, especially in haste, secrecy, or mystery.
To animate with vigor; to excite; to encourage; to inspirit; sometimes followed by up.
definitions.example: Civil dissensions often spirit the ambition of private men.
